Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Jamie was available to meet to discuss the readings and advise on paper topics.  Sadly, of the 25 students in the class, only two of us took advantage of this.  I found Jamie to be knowledgable, articulate and generous with his time.  He lectured for part of one class and was engaging and interesting.
Made himself available, and eager to meet with students. Thoughtful and well-ranging knowledge of history of philosophy and theology.

Calm, collected, and obviously knowledgeable. His introductory lecture to Yoder was a particular highlight of the course; it was educational, easy to follow, and funny. Honestly, he could speak up more - listening to him helped my time in the course.
It is clear that James was very passionate about the topics we discussed, and would have loved to hear more of his contributions during our class discussions.

He is a great teacher. He challenges students and does a good job leading discussions. He is very knowledgeable and communicates information clearly. He is always available to answer questions or discuss papers.His feedback on papers Is encouraging and helpful.

JD gave excellent feedback on my paper. I appreciated the honesty and rigor of his comments. I have found such comments rare on papers graded in the H range in my degree track. I thoroughly enjoyed being engaged on that intellectual level.
Always open to paper consultation, conversations after class. A helpful and welcoming presence in the classroom, and wish we could have had required sections with him.

Jamie stayed quiet in the classroom most often, but his insights (when he did speak up!) were engaging and lucid and helped to clarify the subject matter at hand. I attended his lunchtime breakout session once which was very helpful in identifying my final paper topic, and in his comments on my final paper I was impressed by his engagement with my writing and themes.
His lecture was engaging and informative. He was helpful and provided specific feedback in the exegesis paper.

Jamie was/is a fantastic TA, ready and willing to go the extra mile in discussions outside of class, assisting Professor Eitel with seminar work, and discussing/critiquing writing assignments.  He has a wonderful, synergistic effect on Prof. Eitel's teaching, and excels in his own lectures.

Our TF Jamie is always readily available to help, he is very knowledgeable, and has always been patient with our questions. I have enjoyed his discussion groups, detailed feedbacks, an I really appreciate his effort to engage the class the best way possible.
Jamie is very knowledgeable and a great addition to the class.
